Reviews.Title: “Great value, great service”
Reviews.Author: Slidester
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you want to experience real Dubai & avoid the flashy, ostentatious bits! My boyfriend & I had a great time. The hotel was a good base to explore the old town, the creek & easily get cabs ( or the open top bus tour!) over to Jumerah Beach area. The service was great, we were met at the airport ( although they did add an extra charge for this on at the end!) & were able to check in at 0800 & go to our room. NB this is important after a night flight from the UK which lands at 6am! The room was big. Huge bed & TV. A large separate kitchen area & bathroom. The room was clean, although the bathroom was a little 'tired' in places. Maid service daily was a high standard. The buffet breakfast was very nice. Something for everyone I'd say- cereal, fruit, toast, croissant, muffins, cooked breakfast, & some Indian selections. Pool area on the roof was great. Good views & clean. Overall I would definitely recommend staying here if you're not looking for over-the-top luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Rolla Residence, Bur Dubai, Feb 2012”
Reviews.Author: chancador
Reviews.Content: Rolla Residence, Bur Dubai Well, if like me, you want to be conveniently situated in the Bur Dubai area near the Al Fahidi metro station, and don’t have the time to make an exhaustive search, but are looking for solidly middle of the road 3-star accommodation with kitchen with no major surprises, then this will suit you, as it did me. I stayed here in Feb 2012, and made the booking after a cursory internet search. I would say that this is solidly 3 star establishment with some things a bit better, and some not quite there. I paid DIR1770 (including taxes) for 4 nights including breakfast, which computes to around US$120/night. Note, this is not particularly cheap, and there are recognized good class hotels available that charge this sort of price. I arrived at the apartment hotel between 6-7am and waited until around 11 for a studio apartement to be ready. I was given a room on the first floor facing the front ie overlooking Al Rolla Street. After about two minutes in this room, I realized that it wasn’t go to work out – too noisy. So I grabbed my bags and went downstairs again. I then waited several more hours until about 3pm, when they gave me room 615 on the 6th floor. This was a lot better, with minor traffic noise from Khalid Bin Al Waleed Road in the distance and some loud music until the early hours from somewhere on Wednesday night only I think it was. The staff at Reception, one male and one female trainee, did not excel themselves during my 9 hour wait. I got the impression that the male staff member was also doubling as telephone operator, and consequently his attention was constantly distracted by the phone. My room was fine. Furniture and fittings were all to a good standard, the only negatives being minor scuff marks around suitcase stand, and mildew marks around aircon ventilator, otherwise everything was clean and in near mint condition. The windows did open, though they were a bit jammed and I had to get the maintenance guy to assist opening them. There are 3 units of plumbing in the apartment that have a plug, - kitchen sink, bath, and bathroom basin. You will be lucky if all 3 plugs are functional, - in neither of the rooms I was shown, did all 3 work. The aircon worked fine, but cools only - ie it is not thermostatically controlled, so I was a bit cold for a couple of days, given the time of year. The network internet in the room works well, and was included in room rate. Somewhat surprisingly, the plastic card in the room next to the door did not control the electrics, which was out of sync with the otherwise decidedly minimalist and economy-minded flavour of this hotel – a temporary glitch I suspect. The kitchenette was clean and had the necessary hardware – and included the basics in the way of cutlery and china etc. But don’t expect extras like washing up liquid, tea towel or sponge. The bathroom, c/w bath, was okay too. Each room has its own water heater. If you like a bath, watch out – water heater doesn’t quite manage a normal size bath, not in Feb anyway. I managed only by topping up with 4-6 loads of hot water from the kettle. If like me, you like to use the stairs even now and then in lieu of the lift, be prepared to negotiate your way past used meal trays, which seem to stay on the stairs for a long time. Not to mention, old newspapers and old telephone directories. Breakfast was very well attended, but like many things in this hotel, breakfast was only ‘just enough’. Chunks of melon and watermelon; and then the hot food was heavy on starch and staples like baked beans, sausage and scrambled egg. Pretty much the same every day, but sufficient to get by. It is definitely not worth buying breakfast if it’s not included in your rate. Near the restaurant are rest rooms – if you are male, be prepared to wave an arm around in the air whilst using the urinal, otherwise the lights will go out before you have finished. The clientele in this hotel whilst I was there was I would guess around 80% subcontinent, balance Arab, European, Chinese etc. In general, the clientele were somewhat demanding, so the Filipina restaurant staff looked decidedly battle-worn by the end of the breakfast session. I didn’t ask, but I assume that this hotel was alcohol-free, and this would be in keeping with conservative ambience of the hotel. If you want an environment that is a bit more lively at a similar price, try the Imperial Suites Hotel over the road. I would say that the Hotel Management at Rolla Residence was good in regard to attention to detail. For example, whilst I was staying at the hotel, technicians were busy fitting 2 security cameras to each floor.

Reviews.Title: “good for family”
Reviews.Author: ranjan1967
Reviews.Content: Recently in dec 2011 we six family visited Dubai. We all had stay in this hotel .our experiences were very good. Location wise it is very good. Markets, metro station & lots of restaurants are in vicinity. Not costly. Breakfast witch is complimentary was also very good. Rooms were studio apartments. All rooms were having facilities of cooking, washing machine & ironing. The only problem we faced was bit poor maintenance & lack of man power.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: MeghaChaddah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located within a 5 minute walk from the Al Fahidi metro station. Its is close to Old part of Dubai i.e Bastakiya, Diera as well as Karama market (15-20 min walk). The hotel rooms are quite spacious, well equipped with a washer, microwave, cooking facilities, refrigerator. The bathroom though is a bit tired looking but nevertheless for the price charged it is awesome value for money. And lastly the breakfast is included and is extremely extensive with a variety of breads, croissants, eggs to order, fruits, cereals, a few Indian dishes. So all in all its a good place to stay at a reasonable cost in a city that can be quite pricey! And we stayed in quite a few places in Dubai, this one turned out to be the most reasonable, well connected with easy access to public transport!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but decent-sized rooms and a good value for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Frugaldave
Reviews.Content: My company uses the Rolla Residence for crew members joining or leaving their ships stationed in the Mid-East, so I usually have 1 to 3 night stays here every 3 months or so. The rooms are large with a kitchen area which came in especially handy one time when my ship was delayed and it was during Ramadan, so I could reheat my dinner left-overs for lunch the next day. The breakfast buffet is okay, with polite wait-staff. Many guests are unaware that made-to-order omelettes are also available (no ham of course!). I have never been tempted by their lunch or dinner menu, but as others have mentioned there are many decent Indian restaurants nearby (my favorite is Nawab's in the mall next to Spinney's); also there are US fast food choices in a nearby mall (McDonalds, KFC, etc.) for the less adventurous. The metro is within walking distance; as well as the abras (water taxis) on Dubai Creek to get to the Gold & Spice Souk, although during the "warmer" months the 20 minute walk might do you in. The front desk staff are helpful with directions and tours. The beds are comfortable, the showers/ curtain are a challenge to use without soaking the adjacent floor. There is an on/off switch for the shower's hot water heater on the outside wall before entering the bathroom, which some may not notice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient, Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Gbkhaund
Reviews.Content: Rolla Residency rooms are clean and spacious...It is decent value for money ..plus the convenience of being in Bur Dubai right next to supermarkets like Choitrams, Spinneys etc.. The staff is generally very blunt and sometimes rude too...Specially at breakfast ..One understands that it is rush hour but a customer is a customer at the end of the day. If you ask for anything they give an exasperated look and answer you as if they are doing you a favour. I made multiple request to lety me borrow the high chair for half an hour ( I offred to pick it up and drop it back) and they just rudely refused. They had 4-5 of them in the coffee shop and it was a small window and considering the fact that as a family we had 4 rooms booked almost for a fortnight they could have made an exception.It's not that I wanted it permanently in my room.Feeding a fussy toddler in a busy coffe shop can be difficult.. For most things the staff had an "I Don't care" attitude. The room service food is not so great so I wouldnot recommend ordering anything other than the basic stuff.. Most good restaurants deliver in Bur Dubai and one can call 118 and get the numbers and order than using the hotel restaurant...The housekeeping staff does not clean the rooms so well...if you are on a long stay it's better to once supervise and tell them what you expect. The electricity in teh room tripped often.. Maybe they have a lot of equipment and the supply cannot handle the load. I am still giving it 3 beacuse of teh space and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your Dollar”
Reviews.Author: carol f
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this place to anyone looking for affordable clean accommodation. There were 3 of us adults sharing myself, husband & daughter. The apartment we had had 2 toilets,good size bedroom, lounge with large sofa bed & kitchen. The staff were very friendly & were very accomodating to our needs. The Fayers family

Reviews.Title: “Please read this (and entirely) before you make a decision!”
Reviews.Author: Mrinmay
Reviews.Content: We had booked a studio room in Rolla Residence for a period of 3 days in December. When we arrived, we were told that we had to stay for the first day at another hotel, as due to some sort of miscommunication, they had given our room to someone else for the first day. We had no choice, and the hotel very blatantly asked to move to the other hotel. It was obvious they had to provide us a drop at the other hotel, but they refused to provide so. After a lot of quarelling, they did provide it. When we reached the other hotel, for about an hour, the hotel's General Manager refused to give us a room, saying that he is not answerable to Rolla Residence's last minute requests. So we were left stranded over there, for about an hour or so, after which they did give us a room. We were told we had to come to Rolla Residence back by 2 PM the next day. But the hotel we had to stay in for the first day ahd its check out time at 12 Noon. So we requested a pick up from Rolla at 12 Noon. Again, they whined and refused, but finally sent a pick up at 12 30 PM. When we reached Rolla, at 12 45PM, they said they will give us a room in 2 minutes. But they took a good 45 minutes to do so, again, we were sitting idle in the hotel lobby. We got the room finally, but one day (for which we paid the money) was totally wasted in moving in and out of the other hotel and the other troubles accompanying it. The hotel room, was good, clean and spacious. No complaints. But we never got hot water. Even after notifying the staff twice. The breakfast has a good menu, but lacks taste. For example, Baked Beans on toast lacked salt and acidity, whereas the Sambhar prepared was too acidic. The public bathroom attached to their coffee shop was exhausted of soap and bathroom paper rolls, and it seems that the person who has recently used it did not how to aim correctly, and the hotel authorities did not know how to clean it properly. We were so overhwhelmed by this turn of events that we did not even feel like trying their amenities, like the swimming pool or the steam/sauna. So no comments on that. All in all, I will say, miscommunication does happen, but it should be handled with care keeping the customer sentiment in mind, which Rolla did not.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights at rolla :)”
Reviews.Author: Jiten D
Reviews.Content: this is a perfect getaway for an indian family...spacious serviced apartments, very well located on rolla street in bur dubai...just 5-7 minutes walk to the metro station...supermarket's at both ends of the street...just loved the breakfast, every day a special indian meal like idli sambhar, ragda pattice, puri bhaji...what more one want...would definitely return back with the family :) highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for the stopover stay”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights and I can only recommend this city hotel VERY MUCH , it has very convenient location, 15 minutes drive from airport ( the hotel provide free shuttle from and to airport), the metro station is only 5 minutes walk, there are supermarkets, restaurants and plenty of another shops in neighbourhood. The greek 15 minutes walk. The hotel itself is very clean even it´s older property, quiet although the busy location. Fully furnished kitchenette is a big plus, even we cooked only a coffee :-), for a longer stay I would use it for sure. The staff very helpfull, very polite and provided us with a quick servise, we had city tour after 5 minutes after asking at reception desk, excellent ! Breakfast was perfect, we had only two but there was everyday a different a choise. If Dubai then I would choose Rolla residence again.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Christine B
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rolla Residence from Australia around 7.00am and were immediately escorted to our room and offered a glass of orange juice. We found the staff to be very helpful, friendly and courteous. The room was clean and the beds very comfortable. From the pool area on the roof, the views of the Burj Khalifa and towards the Burj Al Arab were good. The free shuttle service to the airport was excellent. All in all superb value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Misled by the reviews here”
Reviews.Author: Ritika p
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay with my family last week in Rolla Residence relying upon the excellent reviews that the hotel had got on Trip Advisor. The hotel building is hidden on Rolla Street and there are no sign boards on the road. Once we were able to figure out the hotel building, we were greeted by rude staff at the hotel reception who tore out our visas from our passport without our consent. The room allotted to us was a horror story and stinking of cheap freshner and damp and dirty carpet and walls. We opened the windows but even that did not help much. At their end, they tried to placate us with some more cheap freshener. Then after constant complaints, we were offered rooms without carpets and that too was made to sound like an obligation by the reception staff. The card slot in the new room fell off when we tried to insert the key card. At our suggestion, the card slot was put together with scotch-tape. Wish it was actually value for money as the hotel has been (falsely) advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Adequately Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jonnywizznbee
Reviews.Content: Very good value for money at around 30 GBP per room including breakfast. The room was clean and tidy (with free internet access) and the washing machine in the kitchen came in really handy. The bathroom was clean but somewhat tired. Hotel is good for visiting the old part of Dubai and very near the electrical souks/markets and not too far from a metro station, in a predominantly Indian part of town. A short cab ride (20DHM/3.50GBP) to Dubai Mall/Burj Kalifa, and around 40DHM to The Emirates Mall which is about 30 minutes away. Cabs are easy to get from outside the hotel. Two large supermarkets very close by which came in handy as it was Ramadan so no eating or drinking in public during daylight hours (no foods outlets open), despite the temperature being in the 40s. The hotel is about 15 mins from the airport and has a free shuttle bus. The rooftop pool is nothing special but gives welcome relief from the heat. The staff are very pleasant and there's a great Indian restaurant next door (The Jewel of India).

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: roxan_patel
Reviews.Content: Right in the heart of Bur dubai,very clean and nice appartments the studio apts are economical & are extremely well done. they have a special floor only for the girls & women,its all in pink,all the help are girls only so suits best for mothers & daughters travelling all alone.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY AND WE WILL BE BACK....”
Reviews.Author: sollymolly
Reviews.Content: We stop over in Dubai every time we travel and been in other hotel apartments. We decided to try the Rolla for 5 nights and we were very impressed. The room was quite big with a sitting area and a fully equiped kitchnette Very clean, quite and the staff was always helpfull. The breakfast is included with enough choice to start your day. There is a free parking facility. The pool on the roof looked very nice and clean. We used the Metro and the feeder buses every day to go to the Malls (Emirates and Dubai) and found it to be very efficient. We definitely recommend Rolla Hotel and that is where we will stay again next time in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Genuine option for Indians”
Reviews.Author: Jinesh27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at rolla on advice of our travel agent and I was really amazed with the studio apartments there at such a reasonable cost. The hotel looked ordinary from outside but hospitality and rooms were very attractive. Staff was mostly Indian ,they were very coperative and helpfull to us ,even helped us get good discounts on our tour booking for desert safari and Atlantis Park. The hotel was a great location for vegeterians like us, most of the famous Indian restaurants that too pure veg are located in vicinity of the hotel closest Is kailash parbat just next door,sukh sagar and rangoli are another popular Mumbai chains located in the area.Dubai metro is also at a walking distance and I suggest you take a trip to emirates mall in the metro.have a good stay.thank u

Reviews.Title: “Huge apartments”
Reviews.Author: TroubledAditi
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay in this area as I had had good experiences here a couple of years before. Indeed, for going out the location is excellent, very safe and lots of nightclubs nearby. And yet it's close to Dubai Creek and the souqs. The "studio" was probably the biggest hotel room/apartment I've ever stayed at. Also the bathroom was huge and kitchen well-equipped. The hotel is a bit worn-out but everything was clean, apart from the toilet bowl brush which definitely needed to be replaced. Self-catering is easy, both Spinneys and Choitrams are close by. But the hotel also has two Indian restaurants. Personally I very much enjoyed having several Indian channels on TV. The pool area could be improved... the pool is on the rooftop and you can surely get a good tan, but the temperature of the water should be controlled. Already in April the water was almost too hot for swimming. The gym is next to the pool, the equipment old but functioning. Service was a bit rude, both when checking in and when checking out. The hotel offers free airport transfers but I was flying via Abu Dhabi and only needed to go to the Etihad office (which is much closer than Dubai airport!) but they said no, we only offer complimentary transfer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “super gud hotel- Iqbal”
Reviews.Author: iqbaldgreat Posted by a Cleartrip traveler
Reviews.Content: super gud hotel, just close ur eyes n land! ok.-Iqbal

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel. Real value for money”
Reviews.Author: Poorany
Reviews.Content: Just got back home from a trip overseas's we stayed at this hotel. The staff were excellent, the rooms were of combination of a hotel room and service apartment, nice and big to help with the packing. They picked us up and dropped us off at the Ethihad transfer point in Dubai, the rooms were great . Real value for money,and will stay again on my next trip to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “What can I say?!?!? A 5 stars place for a price next to nothing”
Reviews.Author: MaiUK
Reviews.Content: Rolla Residence was fabulous experience, we arrived into dubai for a holiday, we were booked into another hotel, the place was not as we saw online so we couldn't stay, we've moved to another place which is on the same road as rolla residence, the place was filthy, we put our luggage in the room then walked out in a search for another place to stay, my husband pointed at rolla residence and I really didn't want to enter there cuz I was already disappointed with two places already, but beleive me when I stepped inside u can tell that this will be different, we asked to be shown the rooms before moving in, and OMG the rooms were fantastic, its what you find in 5stars hotels, smells clean, looks clean and wonderful staff, we've agreed on the price and moved in.. why to waste your money on a very expensive hotel where u still can get the same quality of rooms and service at rolla residence @ more affordable price, the price was amaizing we decided to take two rooms which have a door in between cuz we were two adults and two kids.. Rolla Residence is the place to stay in Dubai and I will stay there when ever I come to Dubai...

Reviews.Title: “Rolla residence Dubai - value for money”
Reviews.Author: sajiseb
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days, with family. The location is perfect, in Bur Dubai, close to the points of interest for most visitors Had done the booking over emails, absolutely no hazzles or request for advance payment. Has a spacious parking lot. However finding a parking slot for visitors is a hassle. No space for even taxis to stop (unless they stop the traffice in the lane - they didnt seem to mind doing it) spacious apartments. The restaurant (used for for buffet breakfast which was included in the tariff) didnt offer much choice. Staff were friendly

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable and nice 24-hours' check-in/check-out hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarioXP
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the Air Emirates office and made a good choice! We traveled from Venice to Bangkok via Dubai and spent 23 hours in Dubai between the flights. People from Arabian Adventure (engaged by the Air Emirates) waited for us at the airport and took us by shuttle to hotel. We arrived at the hotel at 2 am and were greeted with the glass of juice and a warm smile of our bell boy. The room was already waiting for us. Rooms are spacey with small kitchen - they are called studios. Ours was like that. Everything was nice and clean, very comfortable (the bathroom as well). Breakfast had Indian and western food - we liked it, but it was nothing extra special. The staff - very friendly and professional. Hotel itself is located 20 minutes walk from the downtown. Finally, we were waited by the Arabian Adventure driver (three hours prior to our flight ) at the hotel who drove us back to the airport. Well organized.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable”
Reviews.Author: RMSA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well maintained and comfortable. Not very plush but convenient. Our rooms were large enough for 2 and each room had a well appointed kitchen. A good tasty breakfast - if a bit repetitive - and attentive waiters. If you are not going to spend to much of time in your room this hotel is ideal. If you do, you may feel slightly cramped - our view was the street at the back of the hotel - dry and dusty. We didn't use the pool but it did look very inviting! There is a 24 hour supermarket, a pharmacy, a beauty salon, laundromats and a large shopping centre all within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad really”
Reviews.Author: Chiche77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family during the summer and it wasn't the best time to go as the heat was sweltering but oh, i loved the city! I was told that Rolla was a 3 star hotel when booking thru the Emirates package but it really isn't. It's a Standard hotel and boldly written outside. Wasn't bad at all though. Clean, functional and spacious rooms. The TV though was too small and they really need to improve on their breakfast buffet. Not a lot of variety at all! If you are just looking for a nice hotel to stay in and groove that city, then this is it. If you are looking for breathtaking, it isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: SharBahrain
Reviews.Content: We booked into the Rolla Residence as a part of the Emirates Stopover Package as my parents were visiting from India..all I can say is that we had a good time.From the moment we arrived the hotel staff were couteous and vey helpful.....The rooms were neat and self sufficient .....overall a good experience.A mention for the restaurant though..............the food is wholesome but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice residence”
Reviews.Author: LeandKe
Reviews.Content: We were in this hotel for 3 nights. The rooms are big and clean. We have a room with kitchen, microwave oven, wash maschine, refrigerator. Breakfast were averages - not big choice. Rolla Residence has a small pool and fitness. We were in this hotel through Arabic Adventure. Transport from and to the airport was in price included.

Reviews.Title: “Warm reception, service with a smile and pure comfort”
Reviews.Author: Varana
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the hotel, we were shown the best example of hospitality. Every employee offers service with a smile. The rooms were excellent and we were able to rest after a long flight in quiet, comfortable and clean room. Rolla Residence ensure a superb stay by attending to every detail with a passion for the hospitality industry. The location of this hotel is great for shopping as it is a stone's throw away from Meena Bazaar. We took a taxi to Jumeira and Palm Islands, all promptly arranged by the hotel staff. What a memorable experience. We were impressed and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Breakfasts of instant stuff; staff diligent but gloomy”
Reviews.Author: rubberunethical
Reviews.Content: It's just me. I love service with a smile. Ideal hoteliers should enjoy feeding, making comfortable and solving problems for guests like I serve my family and friends. Management needs to review policies to create happy atmosphere for staff and guests. Wonder if staff are happy with work and living conditions provided; I'm a victim smarting from deception escalated to bullying by management. Downtown hotel's breakfasts of suspiciously -like -leftovers (included in the package ) cannot compare with the food booths outside which smell and taste so appetizing for only 5 AED for a chai, coffee, curry or bryani - all freshly concocted not reheated to rubberiness and evaporated flavors.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in downtown Bur Dubai”
Reviews.Author: cdchess
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a couple of nights at the hotel. The one bedroom room was large and very clean. I slept well. There is a small kitchenette area which is useful. The pool/gym areas on the roof are small and not fancy, but were adequate. The price of the hotel compared well for the ameneties on offer. Check in was easy etc. Didn't try breakfast. The hotel is located on a side street close to a number of supermarkets. Getting a taxi in my experience is not easy anywhere in Bur Dubai, and on checkout after waiting over 5 minutes with no taxis in sight, the doorman got me a lift from a local who was outside the hotel. Hence I really don't agree with the taxi comments provided in the previous thread. Locationwise is good for the Dubai Museum, Bastakiya, the Dubai souk and across the creek on an Abra to the main souks in Deira. A 15-20 minute walk to these areas. In mid October this was just about feasible but during hotter times you would need a taxi. This is not a tourist area, but a bustling, busy city centre. When you do walk about, don't expect to see many other tourists doing the same thing. For everything else in Dubai, (e.g. the beach, resort hotels etc), taxis are required and are well priced when you can get them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: The_World_08
Reviews.Content: Apartment style accomodation located in the heart of downtown Bur Dubai. Walking distance to the Dubai Museum, Dubai River, abra stations & the Gold & Spice souks. 24 hour supermarket directly accross the road with atm & money exchange facilities. Heaps of restaurants to choose from in the area. Apartment was fully self contained with kitchen, washing machine etc. Very cheap internet access in the foyer. Was the perfect choice for a week stay in Dubai. Only a very cheap cab ride to new Dubai & all the flash placs Dubai is now famous for! Cabs available out front of the hotel all times.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Credo505
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here and altho initially we thought it was a little isolated, we discovered the shopping complexes in the next block were very convenient. Staff were helpful. We thought the chinese restaurant next door served good food but was not especially good value. Disappointed there were no shade areas around the roof top pool. It was far too hot up there for us to use it.

Reviews.Title: “5/5 Great Hotel a little treasure in a city of bright lights...”
Reviews.Author: dubai38
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 8-night stay at the rolla residence in a studio apartment. The hotel apartments are fantastic. The apartments are large, clean & very comfortable. The food at the hotel is also good & the Indian restaurant beside the apartment is great & they also deliverer, but when staying in Dubai every restaurant delivers. The pool is also very good & everything is near to hotel, gold souk, Burjamun centre, City Centre, Karama etc. The hotel staff are amazing! the guys on the concierge desk when not busy will even go the supermarket for you… This is not 5 star but a great alternative that is affordable when staying in Dubai for a few days. We left the Rolla Residence & stayed at Grand Hyatt for 4 nights (This is one of Dubai best) we preferred the Rolla it is smaller & u do not get lost in all the people you are the main focus for the staff… Contact the Rolla Residences directly : They offer great reates... Website : http://www.rollaresidence.com/

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: tokumboh
Reviews.Content: the hotel was very clean , the breakfast was good and inclusive, my children loved the hotel, took lessons at pool.the pool was very clean. the housekeeping staff excellent ,desk staff, ok. but be wary of booking thier associated tour company., you may want to compare with others. its a hotel apartment, we stayed in the one bedroom between 23rd december 2007 and 4th january 2008.the kitchen was so spacious and well equipped. its not far from the algubabi busstation ,with buses and taxis to most areas of dubai and other uae emirates. there is a good supermarket just accross the road, and a currency exchange. all in all a very good experience. best for families. but is fine for all.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AucklandKiwifamily
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as a family of five. Great hotel, within walking distance to the Creek and the Souks. Several Malls, and restaurants nearby. 20mins to the beach by taxi (very cheap). All rooms have fully equipped kitchens for self catering, supermarket across the road. Rooms clean and comfortable- huge super king bed. Roof top pool great at the end of a full day sightseeing! We had the buffet breakfast in the restaurant which was good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great all-rounder”
Reviews.Author: ReetzM
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 day stopover in Dubai, but as we were arriving around 1am and leaving around 2:30am, we need a place that offered 24 check in. This hotel offers this and the ease of checking in and out was great. The rooms are big! The beds & pillows are the best I have had travelling -- wish we could have brought them home. We wish we could have stayed longer in Dubai to make full use of this room and its facilities. As per other reviews, pretty close via taxi to most locations. Air conditioning was perfect. There is an Indian restaurant next to/connected to the hotel, and it has great food at an affordable price. We had $75AED left and 4 of us to feed. We had enough food with that price for at least 5-6 people. Concerting that into Australian money, what we paid for the whole meal, is less than what you'd pay per person here.

HotelInfo.Name: Rolla Residence
HotelInfo.Address: Al Rolla Road | P.O. Box 29490, Dubai, United Arab Emirates
